column4: There’s a big fight going on over Florida’s waterways.  It’s public health and safety vs. special interest profit, and I’m fighting to expose the truth.  Here’s the latest #LakeOFactCheck: https://t.co/UbZeIGVulx

This is just the latest in a long list of reasons to stop toxic discharges from Lake Okeechobee. We must continue the fight to protect our public health and human safety!
https://t.co/r29447cFya

Thank you to every single one of the volunteers at the Treasure Coast Food Bank who have given their time during this pandemic to help others. Our community is grateful for all that you do! https://t.co/nba8ZEB5VK

The Central Everglades Planning Project is critical to moving more water south during the dry season, which in turn helps prevent toxic discharges into our community. Breaking ground on this new infrastructure is exactly what we need to protect our community’s public health. https://t.co/RCMiwREtMx

(2/2) But nothing more than zero discharges is acceptable when public health is at risk, and I will keep fighting to make that a reality.  The Army Corps must utilize full operational flexibility, move more water south and end these discharges!
https://t.co/lvxNHSTy2S

The Army Corps announced that they will be discharging from Lake O next week. These discharges could have been avoided had the Corps stayed the course & sent more water south in the dry season. We cannot tolerate a status quo that jeopardizes our health!
https://t.co/fyBiB6Kyv5

Brianna and I are praying for a speedy recovery for President Trump, the First Lady, and everybody fighting coronavirus!

The Army Corps announced new plans this week to begin aquatic plant management on Lake O using toxic chemicals (like glyphosate) that pollute our waterways, jeopardize our health and contribute to HABs. I'm urging them to use mechanical harvesting for this project instead! https://t.co/3P00EOgBgT

Better management of Lake O can make a huge difference for our estuaries! #ZeroDischarges #SendTheWaterSouth

Of course, better management of Lake O & Kissimmee would also make a huge difference for health of Lake O #StopTheSpraying

Lots more fight left!

https://t.co/KkmrBNi3Rp

Don’t let this week’s political stunt by Nancy Pelosi fool you: it’s designed to hide the fact that she's actually cut more working days from the Congressional calendar while she stonewalls efforts to pass a bipartisan coronavirus relief package. We need to get back to work! https://t.co/TmE96MMiFw

It’s no secret that toxic discharges from Lake Okeechobee are harming our environment and our public health. It’s well-past time for the Army Corps to #StopThePoisoning. I'll continue fighting to implement real operational change that benefits both the east & the west coasts! https://t.co/m3s3hrcpVN

We cannot afford another lost summer. Not now, and not ever again. That’s why I introduced legislation to make it illegal for the Army Corps to discharge water that tests above the EPA’s human health standard. Read more:
https://t.co/gEFDlm0CeP

The Corps has proven that they will continue to poison our communities w/ toxic discharges unless we tell them that they cannot. I introduced a bill to make it illegal for any water above the EPA’s human health standard to be discharged into our community.

My sons football&baseball practice,on a walk,riding my bike or Harley,any parking lot I walk through,at the beach,sandbar,boat ramp,doing yard work.On a side note, isn’t it hard to sniff people with a mask on?

Another one of my amendments in this year’s Water Resources Development Act authorizes the Loxahatchee Watershed Restoration Project. This important CERP project will help restore the natural flow of water, promote healthy waterways and improve aquatic ecosystems! https://t.co/wMwoFZkN6R

For too long, the Army Corps has failed to properly notify Floridians about the health risks posed by discharges. My amendment in WRDA would change that by requiring the Corps to work w/ federal & state agencies to monitor, forecast, and notify of cyanobacteria levels in Lake O. https://t.co/ne5u7P61Vn

For decades, FL's coastal communities have been on the receiving end of toxic discharges that have wreaked havoc on our economy, environment & public health. My provisions in WRDA 2020 will help reverse this cycle by reducing discharges & combating HABs!
https://t.co/9V0tQaXyZ4

Our bill we are about to vote on will accelerate construction of the EAA reservoir and force the Army Corps to reduce discharges. It is critical to our public health, the environment and our economy! #StopTheDischarges and #SendTheWaterSouth! https://t.co/K0O5ez9zBe

(Part 2): As the Transportation & Infrastructure Committee debates the Water Resources Development Act, our fight continues to prioritize public health over special interests! ...to reduce discharges, expedite the EAA reservoir and combat harmful algal blooms!  But our fight continues during this debate to prioritize public health and water supply over special interest profit.  Watch now as the hearing gets underway. ⬆️
